page.title: 10Pembs.Coast National Park
page.content: The coastal area is outstandingly beautiful,rich in flora and fauna.Most of the coastline is rocky,with steep cliffs.There are 2 small coves,a larger sandy beach and 2 shingle beaches.All are unspoilt.The whole area is part of the{Pembs.Coast {National Park}and is administered with the aim of combining tourist facilities with conservation.Farmers and other residents must keep to the National Park bye-laws regarding the appearance and use of buildings. Camping is not allowed except on recognised sites.Car-parking is limited. National Park wardens work in the area throughout the year.They patrol and maintain the long-distance Coastal footpath which passes through the area.They monitor wildlife and historical sites,lead walks and give talks on similar topics.
